div1.p: Randin sends Hench two photographs of Agramonte Hospital, showing the spot where Lazear died. See Spanish original.

div1.head: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from J. Randin to Philip Showalter Hench, March 12, 1942
div1.opener:
Ciudad Militar, Cuartel “Cabo Parrado”
March 12, 1942
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Distinguished Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I have the pleasure of sending you enclosed two
copies of aerial photographs of the Military Hospital,
“Dr. Aristides Agramonte”, in accordance with your request
of February 16.

I regret not to be able to please you in sending
you exactly the one published on page 103 of the Second Year
of the magazine (Journal) of Military Sanitation, because
it is a photograph which is a little old, and we do not have
the negatives nor the positives; but I believe the one I am
sending shows very well the place where Dr. Lazear died. The
second photograph is an enlargement of the ground of the
Hospital and the part where it is situated, which I sent
because it is of use also.

closer.salute: I remain, very sincerely, your companion (colleague)
